author: Mo Alsharaf
comment: Using on Huawei stainless steel watch. Display automatically turns bright for scanner and returns back to normal - great feature! I also use Quickbar app but this one loads and operates much smoother. For new cards, having to enter the barcode number rather than loading photo or scanning is not that much of a big deal.
title: So far works nicely.

author: Michael W
comment: Wish you could save your input with sign-in, other than that, this is awesome! I love using it with my LG Cellwatch. Put your code number in and scan anywhere you normally scan. Great for going to the gym especially. I used to carry my smartphone in to the gym so I could scan in. Now I can just scan with my watch, listen to my Bluetooth music, and get phone calls leaving my phone behind. People usually balk their eyes in amazement just because I scan things with the watch. Mostly because they can't believe it's not an Apple Watch. For the millionth time... nooo... it's not an Apple Watch!  🍏⌚😎

author: Joachim Marthinsen Giæver
comment: No backup solution, and not possible to scan and detect both the card number and code type. It should also be possible to add a note, or add photos of the original card 💳 Some of my cards have different barcode numbers and membership number. And in some situations I need both.
title: Ok app

author: Xander Warrender
comment: I agree with another user:  location support would be the best addon for this.  It would be nice if it could scan codes in but I don't have a ton of cards so it doesn't kill me to type them in once.  That said, a backup/restore feature couldn't hurt either.
title: Very good but  needs more polish

author: Andrew G
comment: Puts a bar code on my watch, whenever I need it. The app does exactly what it's supposed to. Sometimes the bar code is a little slow to load, but it's only a couple seconds. Overall this app is exactly what I need, and works great.
title: Works great

author: Jeffrey Klassen
comment: The watch interface is nice but adding new cards is a pain.  Should be able to just scan them with the phones camera. Also bit more polish on the phone interface would be nice.
title: Pretty good.

author: Dan Cunningham
comment: Give this a miss. Tried several scanners without success. Back to cards for me!
title: Several scanners .... no luck

author: Saul V
comment: Idea is on the right track but the fact it doesn't let you store info on a cloud base system to be able to restore information makes this app almost useless when getting a new phone or after resetting your phone. Lost all info..
title: Good but not great.

author: Sam Bryan
comment: Not all cards work. :( this isn't the programs fault, not all bar cod scanners can read codes off of the phone
title: Most cards work

author: Kevin Straughter
comment: People hate on this app, because they don't know how to determine if the barcode matches the real one, but I think it's an excellent app. It does what it's supposed to do.
title: Great app

author: Shadi Shalabi
comment: I don't know what is the bar code types and some don't even have numbers to copy. Please add scanning ability to auto add number and type.
title: Need to scan to add card

author: Hans Strik
comment: It's too simple. It does not show you a copy of the card.... Taken a look at Beep & Go... That one works great but does not work on a watch

author: Scott Lister
comment: Works very well. I would give five stars if you could scan the card to add it, but other than that it's pretty handy.
title: Very nice

author: Hayden Walker
comment: Be able to set locations for the different cards, so that when you enter a store it pops up on the phone and watch automatically
title: Location card

author: Tim Blalock
comment: Works perfect on my G watch R. For this app to stay in the android race, it's going too need scanner capabilities and QR support. Would be willing to pay as well. 감사합니다
title: On the right track!

author: Shawn McWilliams
comment: I use it for my points cards like canadian tire for example, works really well on my gear live smartwatch
title: Does what it says

author: Werner Beroux
comment: Good minimal permissions. Why two apps that don't share data? Cloud sync could be a good fix for it. Also a paid version without ads. Plus it should set brightness to max like the other app.
title: Why two apps

author: Thomas Lee
comment: This app is a good start but is missing a few key features. 1) Barcode scanner on phone side to make input of membership cards easier.  2) Sync data to cloud
title: Missing a few key features

author: Fred Fisher
comment: No (offline) Watch Storage - so without your phone on you, it's useless ! If you have to carry your phone, there are lots of phone apps that are better !

author: Cuban Midlife Crisis
comment: Working retail. Need barcodes right away. Don't want to keep reprinting lists or carry around unnecessary papers.
title: Lifesaver

author: Mitchell Stringer
comment: Awesome, Would be 5 if it had location support (auto open on location) or tasker support.
title: Great

author: Frank Tedesco
comment: Won't allow for scanned loyalty card? Useless.
title: Next stop is the basement

author: Kamila Součková
comment: ...but it would rock even more if I could add also custom "pictures", like codes from tickets bought online (AirBerlin online check-in, bus tickets, etc.)
title: Does what it should

author: Ja Kub
comment: Great app, like other wrote in comments additional field is needed to add card number besides barcodes, anyway thumbs up, but there is Stocard

author: Benoit Jadinon
comment: Would need barcode scanning, and backup/restore
title: Very good

author: Matt Courtney
comment: Could we get support for importing existing passbook files (.pkpass)? Would save having to manually add each record.
title: Does the basics

author: Yannick Cotrebil
comment: It won't let me add my name or scan a fidelity membership card with my LG watch and my Samsung core prime phone. 😢
title: It's not working

author: Ike Dimitriadis
comment: It has no access to the camera, so you have to type in all the numbers and codes.

author: TheBoi
comment: needs easier way to add barcodes by scanning or pictures
title: good app

author: Graham Griffiths
comment: After entering the barcode it doesn't match my card on any setting.
title: Can't add my card

author: Isaac Jacobs
comment: Flybys and store discount work with their flybys scanners.
title: Use at Coles Group always

author: Leonardo Montero
comment: How to send code to watch, no options on ui.
title: watch membership ***

author: Kevin Koo
comment: Any idea to support QR barcode?

author: Gary Deen
comment: Where are the cards stored so I can backup ? /data/app/com.kode*/ ???
title: Lost all my data...

author: Ronald Weiler
comment: Works great, needs to be able to scan cards.  Cloud backup would be great.
title: Works

author: Dan fenlon
comment: But wont scan on most devices making it worthless
title: Great idea

author: Thomas Bell
comment: Schweetness, like it a lot.
title: Great idea

author: Rob Crowe
comment: Use it for Starbucks

author: Brian Combdon
comment: Works great

author: Kevin Chiu
comment: Works well for basic bar codes, but couldn't do my walgreens rewards card (not sure what type of bar code it is, but it's not one of the supported formats). Would also be better if it included a way to re-order the cards. Right now the only way is to delete all your cards and re-enter them in the order you want. Option to take a picture of a barcode would be awesome too. Overall, though, well done!
title: Works well for basic cards
